figurative_meaning: To be daydreaming or not paying attention.
example: He was completely lost during the meeting; he was in the clouds.

idiom: No hay mal que por bien no venga
literal_meaning: There is no bad from which good does not come.
figurative_meaning: Every cloud has a silver lining.
example: Losing that job turned out to be a blessing; there is no bad from which good does not come.

idiom: Tirar la casa por la ventana
literal_meaning: To throw the house out of the window.
example: For her wedding, she decided to throw the house out of the window and have a grand celebration.

figurative_meaning: It's better to do something late than not at all.
example: He finally apologized; better late than never.

idiom: A otro perro con ese hueso
literal_meaning: To another dog with that bone.
figurative_meaning: Used to express disbelief or rejection of a story or excuse.
example: Don't try to convince me with that excuse; I'm not buying it, take it to another dog with that bone.

figurative_meaning: To be a bit crazy or eccentric.
example: Since she started painting, she's been acting like a goat.

example: I ran into my old friend in Paris; the world is a handkerchief.
